step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Authentication Type Selection
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

field.name: authtype
field.description: NOTE: If you are unsure, leave this set to "Local User Access."

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: LDAP Server Selection
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Add LDAP Server
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

field.name: name
field.description: Descriptive server name, for your own reference.

field.name: ip
field.description: Address of the LDAP server.

field.name: port
field.description: LDAP Server port, leave blank for the default (389 for TCP, 636 for SSL).

field.name: transport
field.description: The protocol used by your LDAP server. It can either be standard TCP or SSL encrypted.

field.name: authscope
field.description:
Semi-Colon separated. This will be prepended to the search base dn above or you can specify full container path.
EXAMPLE: CN=Users;DC=example
EXAMPLE: CN=Users,DC=example,DC=com;OU=OtherUsers,DC=example,DC=com

field.name: userdn
field.description: If left blank, an anonymous bind will be done.

field.name: passdn
field.description: If a user DN was supplied above, this password will also be used when performing a bind operation.

field.name: nameattr
field.description: Typically "cn" (OpenLDAP, Novell eDirectory), "samAccountName" (Microsoft AD)

field.name: groupattr
field.description: Typically "cn" (OpenLDAP, Microsoft AD, and Novell eDirectory)

field.name: memberattr
field.description: Typically "member" (OpenLDAP), "memberOf" (Microsoft AD), "uniqueMember" (Novell eDirectory)

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: RADIUS Server Selection
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Add RADIUS Server
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

field.name: name
field.description: Descriptive name for the RADIUS server, for your reference.

field.name: ip
field.description: Address of the RADIUS server.

field.name: port
field.description: Port used by the RADIUS server for accepting Authentication requests, typically 1812.

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Certificate Authority Selection
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Add Certificate Authority
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

field.name: Create a New Certificate Authority (CA) Certificate
descr
field.description: A name for your reference, to identify this certificate. This is the same as common-name field for other Certificates.

field.name: keylength
field.description: Size of the key which will be generated. The larger the key, the more security is offers, but larger keys are generally slower to use.

field.name: lifetime
field.description: Lifetime in days. This is commonly set to 3650 (Approximately 10 years.)

field.name: country
field.description: Two-letter ISO country code (e.g. US, AU, CA)

field.name: state
field.description: Full State of Province name, not abbreviated (e.g. Kentucky, Indiana, Ontario).

field.name: city
field.description: City or other Locality name (e.g. Louisville, Indianapolis, Toronto).

field.name: organization
field.description: Organization name, often the Company or Group name.

field.name: email
field.description: E-mail address for the Certificate contact. Often the e-mail of the person generating the certificate (i.e. You.)

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Server Certificate Selection
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Add a Server Certificate
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

field.name: descr
field.description: A name for your reference, to identify this certificate. This is also known as the certificate's "Common Name."

field.name: keylength
field.description: Size of the key which will be generated. The larger the key, the more security is offers, but larger keys are generally slower to use.

field.name: lifetime
field.description: Lifetime in days. This is commonly set to 3650 (Approximately 10 years.)

field.name: country
field.description: Two-letter ISO country code (e.g. US, AU, CA)

field.name: state
field.description: Full State of Province name, not abbreviated (e.g. Kentucky, Indiana, Ontario).

field.name: city
field.description: City or other Locality name (e.g. Louisville, Indianapolis, Toronto).

field.name: organization
field.description: Organization name, often the Company or Group name.

field.name: email
field.description: E-mail address for the Certificate contact. Often the e-mail of the person generating the certificate (i.e. You.)

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Server Setup
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

field.name: interface
field.description: The interface where OpenVPN will listen for incoming connections (typically WAN.)

field.name: Protocol
field.description: Protocol to use for OpenVPN connections. If you are unsure, leave this set to UDP.

field.name: localport
field.description: Local port upon which OpenVPN will listen for connections. The default port is 1194. Leave this blank unless you need to use a different port.

field.name: description
field.description: A name for this OpenVPN instance, for your reference. It can be set however you like, but is often used to distinguish the purpose of the service (e.g. "Remote Technical Staff").

field.name: TLS Authentication
field.description: Enable authentication of TLS packets.

field.name: generatetlskey
field.description: Automatically generate a shared TLS authentication key.

field.name: tlssharedkey
field.description: Paste in a shared TLS key if one has already been generated.

field.name: dhparameters
field.description: Length of Diffie-Hellman (DH) key exchange parameters, used for establishing a secure communications channel. As with other such settings, the larger values are more secure, but may be slower in operation.

field.name: crypto
field.description: The method used to encrypt traffic between endpoints. This setting must match on the client and server side, but is otherwise set however you like. Certain algorithms will perform better on different hardware, depending on the availability of supported VPN accelerator chips.

field.name: digest
field.description: The method used to authenticate traffic between endpoints. This setting must match on the client and server side, but is otherwise set however you like.

field.name: engine
field.description: The hardware cryptographic accelerator to use for this VPN connection, if any.

field.name: tunnelnet
field.description: This is the virtual network used for private communications between this server and client hosts expressed using CIDR notation (eg. 10.0.8.0/24). The first network address will be assigned to the server virtual interface. The remaining network addresses can optionally be assigned to connecting clients. (see Address Pool)

field.name: redirectgw
field.description: Force all client generated traffic through the tunnel.

field.name: localnet
field.description: This is the network that will be accessible from the remote endpoint, expressed as a CIDR range. You may leave this blank if you don't want to add a route to the local network through this tunnel on the remote machine. This is generally set to your LAN network.

field.name: concurrentcon
field.description: Specify the maximum number of clients allowed to concurrently connect to this server.

field.name: compression
field.description: Compress tunnel packets using the LZO algorithm. Adaptive compression will dynamically disable compression for a period of time if OpenVPN detects that the data in the packets is not being compressed efficiently.

field.name: tos
field.description: Set the TOS IP header value of tunnel packets to match the encapsulated packet value.

field.name: interclient
field.description: Allow communication between clients connected to this server.

field.name: duplicate_cn
field.description:
Allow multiple concurrent connections from clients using the same Common Name.
NOTE: This is not generally recommended, but may be needed for some scenarios.

field.name: dynip
field.description: Allow connected clients to retain their connections if their IP address changes.

field.name: addrpool
field.description: Provide a virtual adapter IP address to clients (see Tunnel Network).

field.name: defaultdomain
field.description: Provide a default domain name to clients.

field.name: dnsserver1
field.description: DNS server to provide for connecting client systems.

field.name: dnserver2
field.description: DNS server to provide for connecting client systems.

field.name: dnserver3
field.description: DNS server to provide for connecting client systems.

field.name: dnserver4
field.description: DNS server to provide for connecting client systems.

field.name: ntpserver1
field.description: Network Time Protocol server to provide for connecting client systems.

field.name: ntpserver2
field.description: Network Time Protocol server to provide for connecting client systems.

field.name: nbtenable
field.description:
Enable NetBIOS over TCP/IP.
If this option is not set, all NetBIOS-over-TCP/IP options (including WINS) will be disabled.

field.name: nbttype
field.description: Possible options: b-node (broadcasts), p-node (point-to-point name queries to a WINS server), m-node (broadcast then query name server), and h-node (query name server, then broadcast).

field.name: nbtscope
field.description: A NetBIOS Scope ID provides an extended naming service for NetBIOS over TCP/IP. The NetBIOS scope ID isolates NetBIOS traffic on a single network to only those nodes with the same NetBIOS scope ID.

field.name: winsserver1
field.description: A Windows Internet Name Service (WINS) server to provide for connecting clients, which allows them to browse Windows shares. This is typically an Active Directory Domain Controller, designated WINS server, or Samba server.

field.name: winsserver2
field.description: A Windows Internet Name Service (WINS) server to provide for connecting clients, which allows them to browse Windows shares. This is typically an Active Directory Domain Controller, designated WINS server, or Samba server.

field.name: Advanced
field.description: Enter any additional options you would like to add to the OpenVPN server configuration here, separated by a semicolon. EXAMPLE: push "route 10.0.0.0 255.255.255.0"

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Firewall Rule Configuration
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

field.description: Firewall Rules control what network traffic is permitted. You must add rules to allow traffic to the OpenVPN server's IP and port, as well as allowing traffic from connected clients through the tunnel. These rules can be automatically added here, or configured manually after completing the wizard.

field.name: ovpnrule
field.description: Add a rule to permit traffic from clients on the Internet to the OpenVPN server process.

field.name: ovpnallow
field.description: Add a rule to allow all traffic from connected clients to pass across the VPN tunnel.

step.title: OpenVPN Wizard: Finished!
step.description: OpenVPN Remote Access Server Setup Wizard

field.description: Your configuration is now complete.
To be able to export client configurations, browse to System->Packages and install the OpenVPN Client Export package.
